The demand for all things Palm, sugar and oil, is destroying forests and habitat in places like Indonesia where the jungle is being cleared to grow more palm trees leading to the quick demise of Lemers, Orangatans, and other species.  I won't eat any of that.

I don't know whereabouts in canada you live but in Alberta we can take our bottles to the bottle depot and they recycle them, but most people are just lazy. You can also throw them in your blue bin, they are recyclable.

The gas it takes to carry the water from the source to the factory, from the factory to the warehouse, from the warehouse to the store, from the store to your home, makes no sense when we have a tap water in Canada that is of high quality. And I did not get into the energy required to produce the bottles and the energy required to recycle them. REDUCE and REUSE are much more efficient.

You get a stomach ache from milk, because Pasturized milk no longer has the natural enzymes it contains. The heat kills it. So you can't naturally digest milk yourself. Which results in the tummy ache.

Drink it from the cow. You won't ever have that problem.

Enzymes are proteins - and ALL protein you eat, even the 'milk enzymes' are denaturated - so make totally inactive, destroyed etc in your stomach in its low pH. And digestion happen in small intestine so don't fall for the biased information. The thing is most of adults can't properly digest lactose and it causes tummy ache. You can be partially intolerant so you feel unwell but not get sick or have a diarrhoea :)

I believe the reason it's called "vegetable oil" is because it's plant based oil as opposed to being animal fat, not because it comes from veggies. So basically anything coming from seeds, nuts etc. Olive oil (which is good for you) is also a kind of vegetable oil. Peanut oil comes from peanuts so technically there's no reason to consider it unhealthy, if you then consider things like peanut butter healthy. I hope it makes sense.
